## Escape type

Type that converts special characters in a string to JSON Pointer escape sequences. According to RFC 6901, the following transformations are applied

- "<!-- -->\~<!-- -->" is encoded as "<!-- -->\~<!-- -->0" - "<!-- -->/<!-- -->" is encoded as "<!-- -->\~<!-- -->1"

**Signature:**

```typescript
export type Escape<S extends string> = S extends `${infer First}${infer Rest}` ? First extends keyof EscapeMapping ? `${EscapeMapping[First]}${Escape<Rest>}` : `${First}${Escape<Rest>}` : S;
```
**References:** [EscapeMapping](./format.escapemapping.md)<!-- -->, [Escape](./format.escape.md)

## Example


```ts
type T1 = Escape<"a/b">; // "a~1b"
type T2 = Escape<"a~b">; // "a~0b"
type T3 = Escape<"~/test">; // "~0~1test"
```
